key_events.description: JPMorgan downgraded Grupo Mateus to underweight on 2025-12-19, citing a more challenging outlook for revenue growth in 2026.
BB-BI revised GMAT3's price target to R$ 9.00 for the end of 2026 (previously R$ 10.40), maintaining a buy recommendation.
Q3 2025 gross revenue was R$12.1 billion (28.3% growth year-over-year), with net income of R$846 million (net margin 4.7% ex-extraordinary effects).
Grupo Mateus plans to open approximately 30 new stores in 2026.
Grupo Mateus approved payment of R$111.3 million in JCP.
Grupo Mateus approved an increase in capital of up to R$475.9 million.

risk_factors: Challenging outlook for revenue growth in 2026
Negative free cash flow of R$ 101 million in Q3 2025

investment_thesis.bull_case: BTG Pactual sees GMAT3 as a resilient option with low financial leverage and cheap valuation (10x P/L for 2025 and 8x P/L for 2026). BB-BI maintains a buy recommendation with a price target of R$ 9.00 for the end of 2026. Expectation of R$ 1.4 billion in delivery in the first quarter of 2026, which will probably lead to a strong cash generation, and very likely the company will have net cash.
investment_thesis.bear_case: JPMorgan downgraded Grupo Mateus to underweight on 2025-12-19, citing a more challenging outlook for revenue growth in 2026. Q3 2025 free cash flow was negative R$ 101 million due to a higher CAPEX (+28% year-over-year). Novo Atacarejo presented SSS of -0.5% in Q3 2025.

summary_markdown: GMAT3 (Grupo Mateus S.A.) faces a mixed outlook. BTG Pactual sees it as resilient with a cheap valuation (10x P/L for 2025 and 8x P/L for 2026), while JPMorgan downgraded it to underweight on 2025-12-19 due to challenging revenue growth in 2026. BB-BI revised its price target to R$ 9.00 for the end of 2026, maintaining a buy recommendation. Q3 2025 gross revenue was R$12.1 billion (28.3% growth), but free cash flow was negative R$ 101 million. The company plans to open approximately 30 new stores in 2026 and approved a dividend payment of R$111.3 million and an equity increase of up to R$475.9 million. Novo Atacarejo presented SSS of -0.5% in Q3 2025.
